abstract: Japanese families cut spending more than expected and retail sales fall for first time in seven months in January; inflation rate reaches 10-month low.
lead_paragraph: The cut in spending is a sign the central bank’s radical stimulus has yet to convince consumers that inflation will take hold.

headline.main: Japan’s Household Spending and Retail Sales Decline
headline.print_headline: Japan’s Inflation Rate Hits a 10-Month Low

snippet: The cut in spending is a sign the central bank’s radical stimulus has yet to convince consumers that inflation will take hold.
